projects.title: ioaiaaii.net
projects.description: Live Kubernetes-native API for a personal portfolio using Golang, Vue.js, and OpenTelemetry, with fully automated CI/CD pipelines and GitOps workflows in a private GKE environment. Hosted at micro-infra, powered by repo-operator.

projects.title: micro-infra
projects.description: Lightweight GCP private infrastructure running production GKE with Terragrunt and Argo CD, including a self-managed core services stack, automated vulnerability scanning, and a WAF.

projects.title: repo-operator
projects.description: A modular repository management tool that streamlines workflows with Docker-based, hermetic Makefile targets, ensuring isolated, reproducible builds and tests. It can be added as a Git submodule to standardize operations like building, testing, and documentation across repositories.

projects.title: GoDuckDuckGo
projects.description: A set of microservices that answer client queries by interacting with DuckDuckGo’s API. This WIP playground focuses on learning Golang, Software Engineering, and Systems Design within the SRE discipline.

projects.title: Quantum Teleportation
projects.description: An essay on the teleportation protocol, a foundational principle in quantum mechanics that enables quantum state transfer between distant systems using entanglement. It delves into theoretical foundations and demonstrates the protocol’s implementation in Qiskit.

projects.title: Deutsch's Algorithm
projects.description: An analysis of Deutsch’s Algorithm, showcasing its mathematical basis as the first quantum algorithm to demonstrate quantum advantage. The essay includes an implementation in Qiskit, executed on actual quantum systems.

projects.title: Grover's Algorithm
projects.description: An analysis of Grover’s search algorithm, presenting its mathematical framework and illustrating its quadratic speedup for unstructured searches. The essay features Qiskit executions on real quantum hardware.

projects.title: Shor's Algorithm
projects.description: A report on Shor’s factorization algorithm, examining its mathematical principles and implications for cryptography. The essay concludes with an implementation in Qiskit, executed on physical quantum hardware.

projects.title: Unconventional Computing Review
projects.description: A literature review on emerging computing paradigms for the Fourth Industrial Revolution, addressing the limitations of Moore’s Law. It explores reversible, optical, and soliton-based computing as alternatives to conventional methods.
